english: Our traditional grazing lands were restricted.
banjara: apeer peena vur khetari, charayer jammi shee kheench lide
notes: aapner-our, peenaro-traditional, apeer-our, peena vur-traditional, khetari-fields'farms, charayer-graising, jammi-lands, shee-all, kheench lide - took away/ restricted

banjara: apner kunta, talav, khalya, vavdi vun bhi japth kidhe
notes: aapner-our, paani-water, apner-our, kunta-lake, talav-pond, khalya-canal/stream, vavdi-well,  vun bhi- also, japth-controlled, kidhe-did

english: Our women faced violence from settled communities.
banjara: apener yaadi bheenevun, kor kyar katraiko vela paade
notes: aapner-our, eeti-from, apener-our, yaadi vun-mothers, bheene vun-sisters, kor kyar - Kor (other than Gor)/other settled communities, katraiko-soo much, vela-problems, paade-gave

english: Our culture was dismissed as primitive.
banjara: apan gor uen pichadiur nai vendeevur naai dheete
notes: aapner-our, apan-our, gor uen-community/gor, pichadiur nai-primitive/low level/low value, vendeevur-mad people, naai-like, dheete-saw/seen

english: Into this darkness, Sant Sevalal Maharaj brought light.
banjara: ass bhaveturmaa, Sant Sevalal Maharaj roshni laayo
notes: ee-this, ass bhaveturmaa-in this problems/in this struggles, Sant Sevalal Maharaj-Sant Sevalal Maharaj, roshni-light, laayo-brought

english: Into this oppression, he brought dignity.
notes: ee-this, ee-he, izzat-dignity, dabamele jendun-opressed people, hoto-back, izzat-respect/dignity, laayo-brought

english: Into this despair, he brought hope.
notes: ee-this, ee-he, niraashema-in dispair, hoto-back, aasha-hope, jagayo-woke/raised

banjara: satre soo eer anth eer ma
notes: deer-late, satre-17, soo eer-hundred's,  anth eer-end,  ma-in
Hyderabad-Hyderabad , Nizam eer-Nizam's, heet-under, vetthi-was there
